cache_content_add_entry.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00087 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00088 #include "config.h"
00089 #endif

00092 #include "LRU_List.h"
00093 #include "log_functions.h"
00094 #include "HashData.h"
00095 #include "HashTable.h"
00096 #include "fsal.h"
00097 #include "cache_inode.h"
00098 #include "cache_content.h"
00099 #include "stuff_alloc.h"
00100 
00101 #include <unistd.h>
00102 #include <sys/types.h>
00103 #include <sys/param.h>
00104 #include <time.h>
00105 #include <pthread.h>
00106 #include <errno.h>
00107 #include <fcntl.h>
00108 #include <string.h>
00109 
00128 cache_content_entry_t * cache_content_new_entry( cache_entry_t                 * pentry_inode,
00129                                                  cache_content_spec_data_t     * pspecdata,
00130                                                  cache_content_client_t        * pclient,
00131                                                  cache_content_add_behaviour_t   how,
00132                                                  fsal_op_context_t             * pcontext,
00133                                                  cache_content_status_t        * pstatus ) 
00134 {
00135   hash_buffer_t             key ;
00136   hash_buffer_t             value ;
00137   cache_inode_status_t      cache_inode_status ;
00138   cache_content_status_t    status ;
00139   struct stat             * buffstat ; 
00140   cache_content_entry_t   * pfc_pentry = NULL ;
00141   int                       tmpfd ;
00142   
00143   /* Set the return default to CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS */
00144   *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00145   
00146   /* stat */
00147   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00148 
00149 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00150   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00151   BuddySetDebugLabel( "cache_content_entry_t" ) ;
00152 #endif
00153  
00154   if( pentry_inode == NULL ) 
00155     {
00156         *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00157         
00158         /* stat */
00159         pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00160 
00161         return NULL ;
00162     }
00163 
00164   if( how != RENEW_ENTRY ) 
00165    {
00166     /* Get the entry from the preallocated pool */
00167     GET_PREALLOC( pfc_pentry, 
00168                   pclient->pool_entry, 
00169                   pclient->nb_prealloc, 
00170                   cache_content_entry_t, 
00171                   next_alloc ) ;
00172 
00173 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00174     /* For debugging memory leaks */
00175     BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
00176 #endif
00177     
00178   
00179     if( pfc_pentry == NULL ) 
00180        {      
00181         *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_MALLOC_ERROR ;
00182         
00183         DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, 
00184                            "cache_content_new_entry: can't allocate a new fc_entry from cache pool" ) ;
00185 
00186         /* stat */
00187         pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00188       
00189         return NULL ;
00190        } 
00191     }  /* if( how != RENEW_ENTRY ) */
00192    else
00193     {
00194         /* When renewing a file content entry, pentry_content already exists in pentry_inode, just use it */
00195         pfc_pentry = (cache_content_entry_t *)(pentry_inode->object.file.pentry_content) ;
00196     }
00197 
00198   /* Set the path to the local files */
00199   if( ( status = cache_content_create_name( pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_index,
00200                                             CACHE_CONTENT_INDEX_FILE,
00201                                             pcontext,
00202                                             pentry_inode, 
00203                                             pclient ) ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00204     {
00205       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pfc_pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00206 
00207       *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_ENTRY_EXISTS ;
00208       
00209       /* stat */
00210       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00211 
00212       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, 
00213                          "cache_content_new_entry: entry's index pathname could not be created" ) ;
00214 
00215       return NULL ;
00216     }
00217 
00218 
00219   if( ( status = cache_content_create_name( pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data,
00220                                             CACHE_CONTENT_DATA_FILE,
00221                                             pcontext,
00222                                             pentry_inode, 
00223                                             pclient ) ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00224     {
00225       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pfc_pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00226 
00227       *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_ENTRY_EXISTS ;
00228 
00229       /* stat */
00230       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00231       
00232       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, 
00233                          "cache_content_new_entry: entry's data  pathname could not be created" ) ;
00234       
00235       return NULL ;
00236     }
00237 
00238   DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, "added file content cache entry: Data=%s Index=%s", 
00239                      pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data, pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_index ) ;
00240   
00241   /* Set the sync state */
00242   pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.sync_state = JUST_CREATED ;
00243   
00244   /* Set the internal_md */
00245   pfc_pentry->internal_md.read_time         = 0 ;
00246   pfc_pentry->internal_md.mod_time          = 0 ;
00247   pfc_pentry->internal_md.refresh_time      = 0 ;
00248   pfc_pentry->internal_md.alloc_time        = time( NULL ) ;
00249   pfc_pentry->internal_md.last_flush_time   = 0 ;
00250   pfc_pentry->internal_md.last_refresh_time = 0 ;
00251   pfc_pentry->internal_md.valid_state       = STATE_OK ;
00252  
00253   /* Set the local fd info */
00254   pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.opened_file.local_fd  = -1 ;
00255   pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.opened_file.last_op   =  0 ;
00256 
00257   /* Dump the inode entry to the index file */
00258   if( cache_inode_dump_content( pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_index, pentry_inode ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00259     {
00260 
00261       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pfc_pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00262       
00263       *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00264 
00265        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, 
00266                           "cache_content_new_entry: entry could not be dumped in file" ) ;
00267        
00268       /* stat */
00269       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00270       
00271       return NULL ;
00272     }
00273 
00274   /* Create the data file if entry is not recoverd (in this case, it already exists) */
00275   if( how == ADD_ENTRY || how == RENEW_ENTRY ) 
00276    {
00277      if( ( tmpfd = creat( pfc_pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data, 0750 )  ) == -1 )
00278        {
00279          RELEASE_PREALLOC( pfc_pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00280        
00281          *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00282    
00283           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, 
00284                              "cache_content_new_entry: data cache file could not be created, errno=%d (%s)", 
00285                              errno, strerror( errno ) ) ;
00286           
00287           /* stat */
00288          pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00289          
00290          return NULL ;
00291        }
00292      
00293      /* Close the new fd */
00294      close( tmpfd ) ;
00295 
00296    } /* if( how == ADD_ENTRY || how == RENEW_ENTRY ) */
00297   
00298   /* Cache the data from FSAL if there are some */
00299 
00300   /* Add the entry to the related cache inode entry */
00301   pentry_inode->object.file.pentry_content = pfc_pentry ;
00302   pfc_pentry->pentry_inode = pentry_inode ;
00303 
00304   /* Data cache is considered as more pertinent as data below in case of crash recovery */
00305   if( how != RECOVER_ENTRY ) 
00306     {
00307       /* Get the file content from the FSAL, populate the data cache */
00308       if( pclient->flush_force_fsal == 0 )
00309         cache_content_refresh( pfc_pentry, pclient, pcontext, DEFAULT_REFRESH, &status ) ;
00310       else
00311         cache_content_refresh( pfc_pentry, pclient, pcontext, FORCE_FROM_FSAL, &status ) ;
00312 
00313       if( status != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00314         {
00315           RELEASE_PREALLOC( pfc_pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00316 
00317           *pstatus = status ;
00318 
00319           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT,
00320                              "cache_content_new_entry: data cache file could not read from FSAL, status=%u", status ) ;
00321                              
00322 
00323           /* stat */
00324           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00325 
00326           return NULL ;
00327       }
00328     } /* if ( how != RECOVER_ENTRY ) */
00329 
00330   return pfc_pentry ;
00331 } /* cache_content_new_entry */
00332
